sub_title: XR | Immersive Experiences | Holographic content | Spatial Computing | Scientist & Researcher
summary:
As an accomplished Social XR (AR/VR/XR) specialist with expertise in Immersive Media such as point clouds, light field combined with my strong knowledge in signal and data processing, and image processing, I am committed to advancing the frontiers of cutting-edge technology. With a keen interest in 5G, telecommunication and electrical engineering, network technology, photogrammetry, and remote sensing, I am a versatile professional who excels in diverse fields.

Currently working as a Lead Scientist the Networks department (Unit ICT, Strategy & Policy) at TNO, I lead and participate in a wide range of projects, leveraging my research expertise in network-based XR media processing. My research focus spans in the transmission of next-generation media processing technologies, including point clouds and light field, 5G/6G, SDN/NFV and Hyperconverged infrastructures such as edge/cloud computing.

My background in Electrical Engineering, with a specialization in Digital Communications and Space Sciences, was further strengthened by my Master's degrees from ESIEE Paris and Chalmers UT Gothenburg, where I gained in-depth knowledge of Telecommunications Engineering and Signal Processing. Additionally, my PhD from TU Delft in Remote Sensing and Geographical Information System (GIS) honed my analytical and problem-solving skills, enabling me to design innovative solutions for complex research questions.

With bilingual proficiency in French and English and fluency in Dutch, I have a global perspective that enhances my ability to work with diverse teams and communicate effectively across borders. As a dedicated and results-driven professional, I am committed to driving innovation and achieving exceptional outcomes in all my endeavors.

projects:
[{'title': 'Early Research Programme - Social XR', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'Early Research Programme on the topic of Social eXtended Reality.

In this programme, we aim to create a shared XR environment where participants get the feeling of being present at a remote location, referred to as telepresence. Telepresence is not a new idea, but existing telepresence solutions do not at all provide the feeling of being present. 
Our ambition is to enable people to participate in shared events independently of their location, such as live concerts and sport games, online hybrid meetings and situational awareness operations, in which all participants can communicate and interact in a high-quality and realistic manner. This project requires a new approach to vision and audition, (e.g. immersive and head-slaved) and expanding to other sensory modalities, starting with touch.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sylvie', 'last_name': 'Dijkstra-Soudarissanane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'XR | Immersive Experiences | Holographic content | Spatial Computing | Scientist & Researcher'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Omar', 'last_name': 'Niamut', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Towards a digital society'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maria', 'last_name': 'Boen - Leo', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Program Manager at TNO Information and Communication Technology'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Leonor', 'last_name': 'Fermoselle', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Roboticist at Boston Dynamics AI Institute'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Frank', 'last_name': 'Ter Haar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Research Integrator at TNO Defence, Security and Safety'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martijn', 'last_name': 'van den Heuvel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Systems Engineer Intelligent Autonomous Systems bij TNO'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tessa', 'last_name': 'Klunder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'XR / Unity3D Developer at TNO'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Toni', 'last_name': 'Dimitrovski', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Research Scientist at TNO'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alexander', 'last_name': 'Toet', 'name': None, 'headline': 'headline '}]}, {'title': 'EU FP7 Sustainable and robust networking for smart electricity distribution - SUNSEED', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'SUNSEED proposes an evolutionary approach to utilisation of already present communication networks from both energy and telecom operators. These can be suitably connected to form a converged communication infrastructure for future smart energy grids offering open services. Life cycle of such communication network solutions consists of six steps: overlap, interconnect, interoperate, manage, plan and open. Joint communication networking operations steps start with analysis of regional overlap of energy and telecommunications operator infrastructures. Geographical overlap of energy and communications infrastructures identifies vital DSO energy and support grid locations (e.g. distributed energy generators, transformer substations, cabling, ducts) that are covered by both energy and telecom communication networks. Coverage can be realised with known wireline (e.g. copper, fiber)or wireless and mobile (e.g. WiFi, 4G) technologies. Interconnection assures end-2-end secure communication on the physical layer between energy and telecom, whereas interoperation provides network visibility and reach of smart grid nodes from both operator (utility) sides. Monitoring, control and management gathers measurement data from wide area of sensors and smart meters and assures stable distributed energy grid operation by using novel intelligent real time analytical knowledge discovery methods. For full utilisation of future network planning, we will integrate various public databases. Applications build on open standards (W3C) with exposed application programming interfaces (API) to 3rd parties enable creation of new businesses related to energy and communication sectors (e.g. virtual power plant operators, energy services providers for optimizing home energy use) or enable public wireless access points (e.g. WiFi nodes at distributed energy generator locations). ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sylvie', 'last_name': 'Dijkstra-Soudarissanane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'XR | Immersive Experiences | Holographic content | Spatial Computing | Scientist & Researcher'}]}, {'title': 'UFBB Seminar', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Project manager of the Ultra-Fast Broadband seminar
Organization of the event, definition of the program and contacting sponsors.
4 days event organized for experts in the field of copper network, ADSL/VDSL/G.Fast/Fiber/cable. 
Usual attendance: 150 participants, 15 sponsors', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sylvie', 'last_name': 'Dijkstra-Soudarissanane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'XR | Immersive Experiences | Holographic content | Spatial Computing | Scientist & Researcher'}]}, {'title': 'EU FP7 Social Telemedia Environment for Experimental Research - STEER', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'STEER is funded under the FP7. The aim of the STEER project is to explore the dynamic relationship between social information and networked media through experimentation.
In this project, I was responsible for the dissemination activity, within the Work Package 6. I achieved the following:
- Act as a Work package leader
- Establish a dissemination road map
- Keep a regular contact with all partners
- Redesign the website and make it more user friendly
- Create content for the communication platforms (Website, Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkedIn))
- Keep the communication platforms up to date
- Create and update the dissemination table
- Initiate the creation of the Deliverable D6.2: Market assessment
- Presented my actions during the plenary meeting in Delft (September 2013)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sylvie', 'last_name': 'Dijkstra-Soudarissanane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'XR | Immersive Experiences | Holographic content | Spatial Computing | Scientist & Researcher'}]}, {'title': 'EU FP7 Future Internet Gateway-based Architecture of Residential Networks - FIGARO', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': "The Internet has evolved from a technology-centric core network to a user- and content-centric network that must support millions of users creating and consuming content. It must accommodate new services with new requirements and cope with heterogeneous network technologies. The momentum is moving toward the end user who is now capable of creating, storing, and delivering content and services. FIGARO proposes a Future Internet architecture that is structured around residential networks. In this architecture, home gateways have a key role as integrator of different networks and services, and as coordinator of Internet-wide distributed content management. FIGARO will: i) design a novel content management architecture that enables distributed content backup, search and access. This architecture will also support mobile users and wireless ad-hoc content sharing; ii) develop a network optimization framework, leveraging community networks and heterogeneous networks; iii) deliver a network management architecture which includes new network monitoring and real-time troubleshooting techniques; iv) explore novel Internet-based communication and service solutions for emerging sectors, such as energy management and e-health care.We will deliver the components of the FIGARO architecture through an experimental approach incorporating testbed prototyping of solutions. In summary, FIGARO is intended to evolve the current Internet to meet future demands of applications, services and end-users, while preserving its current robustness and increasing its scalability and efficiency. Furthermore, the integration of new sectors into the future Internet will spur trans-sector innovation and create new businesses. The project is expected to result in technologies that will strengthen Europe's position and give competitive advantage to European industry in the areas of Future Internet technologies and services, residential gateways and home automation.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sylvie', 'last_name': 'Dijkstra-Soudarissanane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'XR | Immersive Experiences | Holographic content | Spatial Computing | Scientist & Researcher'}]}]

[{'company': {'id': 3614, 'name': 'TNO', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQFobKDECbgbEQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1688455653111?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=dQNoyjtnSjWWk3GP1ymkFAi7eCDOBG6ocIAG7kYnewo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/tno/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': None, 'title': 'Senior Scientist - Intelligent Imaging ', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'The Hague, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': 'As the Lead Scientist of the TNO Early research program on Social XR, I combine my extensive expertise in AR/VR/XR, 3D modeling, point clouds, light field, signal and data processing, image processing, 5G, telecommunication, electrical engineering, network technology, photogrammetry, remote sensing, project management, and standardization to drive the development of next-generation Social XR technology.

Through this role, I collaborate with a cross-functional team to develop innovative solutions that integrate multimedia technology, telecommunications, and data processing to create immersive, interactive, and social experiences in XR.

My passion for research and dedication to excellence enable me to lead this program to success, driving progress and creating new opportunities in the rapidly evolving field of XR technology.', 'title': 'Lead Scientist', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'The Hague, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': "As a member of the Networks Department's ICT unit, my expertise lies in Immersive Media such as RGBD, Point Clouds, and Light Fields, with a focus on advancing Social XR (AR/VR/MR) technology. I am also well-versed in video codec and point cloud compression, as well as big data processing, telecommunications, and signal processing.

I am a skilled public speaker with experience presenting at conferences and seminars. Additionally, my project management skills are trained by IPMA, and I am adept at leading and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver successful outcomes.

My experience with MPEG standards, particularly PCC and Systems group, has given me a deep understanding of the technical requirements and considerations for developing effective and efficient multimedia solutions for the Metaverse. With a passion for innovation and a commitment to excellence, I am dedicated to driving progress and achieving success in all my endeavors.", 'title': 'Senior Researcher', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': "As a researcher in the Networks Department's ICT unit, I am responsible for a diverse range of projects that require a combination of programming skills, statistical analysis, and multimedia expertise.

My proficiency in Matlab programming enables me to develop a wide variety of applications, from data processing and analysis to simulation and modeling. In my research on Fixed Access Network statistics, I utilize my skills in statistical analysis to derive insights and patterns from large datasets.

In the field of Immersive Media research, I focus on RGBD, Point Clouds, and Light Fields, coupled with Video codec and Point Cloud compression. This requires me to be well-versed in both multimedia technology and data compression techniques. Additionally, my expertise in Big Data processing, Telecommunications, and Signal processing enables me to design and implement innovative solutions for complex problems.", 'title': 'Research Scientist', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 166529, 'name': 'TU Delft', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFwaGpwaod9mQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1670699851986?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=x0gehJn4urFszU2u5SdBucc2zlxk3Ja4h8oWEtjCIYo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/tudelft/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Delft Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'As a PhD candidate in the Geoscience & Remote Sensing department at the Civil Engineering and Geosciences Faculty, I am conducting research on the geometry of Terrestrial Laser Scanning. My focus is on identifying errors, modeling, and optimizing scanning geometry. This research is particularly relevant in the fields of surveying and mapping, where accurate measurements and models are crucial for various applications, such as construction, monitoring of natural hazards, and land-use planning. With a strong background in geospatial data analysis, I am equipped to tackle this complex problem and contribute to advancing our understanding of Terrestrial Laser Scanning and its applications.

PhD research topic: “The geometry of Terrestrial Laser Scanning: Identification of Errors, Modeling and Optimization of Scanning Geometry.”.', 'title': 'PhD Candidate', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'PromooD', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'TU Delft', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'PromooD', 'description': 'As the president of Promood PhD association, I manage a board of 15 members and work to improve communication within our community by reaching out to relevant networks.
